snippet: Surf Air runs on a pricing plan like Netflix’s: pay a membership ($500), a monthly fee ($1,650) and fly as often as you like on six-seat, single-engine turboprops.
abstract: Fledgling airline Surf Air operates on a monthly pricing plan, giving business travelers option of paying membership and monthly fee and flying as often as they like on six-seat, single-engine turboprops; service is between smaller airports in Burbank, Calif, and San Carlos in Silicon Valley, but airline is considering more destinations by end of 2013.
lead_paragraph: Surf Air runs on a pricing plan like Netflix’s: pay a membership ($500), a monthly fee ($1,650) and fly as often as you like on six-seat, single-engine turboprops.

headline.main: All-You-Can-Fly Airline Plies the California Coast
headline.print_headline: All-You-Can-Fly Airline Plies the California Coast
